title: Account Hacked and Cheated on, resulted in a unjust perma ban on my account.
body:
I have been playing league all my teenage years, spending countless hours and lots of money. I have played in many tournaments and played on an OCS team on this account. (Not the account im posting on as it is currently Perma banned)

I decided to have a break from the game and took six months off without re-installing it on my computer just so i can refresh myself. I come back to find that my account was perma banned which shook me as I hadn't touched the game. I decided to further investigate finding that someone has accessed my account, (I have proof it wasn't me as i have emails people putting riot points from other countires onto my account) and was scripting i believe.

I contacted riot support with the evidence and the situation to my surprise they basically just said it is my fault and they don't care who was on it and closed the ticket. After spending the amount of money i have on league and the time i put in it i am not happy with the end result.

Any ideas now?

(Message me for solutions or if a rioter is looking for information on my account.) 

Cheers

replies.body:
Hi there,

In your case this does look like your account was being accessed by someone else when cheats were used. In every case I've seen like this, the account shares either a username, password, or both with another service, and as a result can be easily breached if those services ever get their user account databases leaked.

Support was extremely strict with policy in this case but your ticket was submitted many months ago. I am moving them more towards leniency when dealing with cases where it is evident that an account has been stolen, not shared.

I've un-banned your account and sent you a prompt for another password reset. Please be sure to follow through on that and be sure that the password is strong and unique. Here's a great comic from xkcd that explains how to do this simply: https://xkcd.com/936/

Hi Gehirn, It's sort of a long shot with this one that you see it, but my email password was public from a database leak (account I'm posting from), and I'm in the same boat. I got onto riot support within 2 days but I was already permanently banned and riot support pretty much told me the same thing.

It's pretty sad to see my 100's of days spent on league of legends go down like this:

The request:  https://puu.sh/AsEpp/a46c3b1559.png

What I come back to when I try to log in: https://puu.sh/AsKdr/5127fc7ff6.png

They played 5 games only on the account before they got it banned, the last 3 of which are pre-made with some of their friends I presume. Basically I had my account taken for a joyride.

I have all my game logs and would be able to provide anything support needs but they pretty bluntly responded saying it was banned for "scripts, hacks, exploits or unauthorised third-party programs in League of Legends"  and that context doesn't matter regardless. If you could help me in anyway I would greatly appreciate it. Its really sad to see my years spent playing leauge come to an end like this.

You can post from a perma-banned account, as long as it's not also forum-banned.

You mention that during your 6 months break of League, someone was using your account and putting RP into it, which you state that you have emails (note the plural) to prove that there were RP purchases not authorised and initiated by yourself.

So here are the questions:

* Did you also take 6 months break from your email? Why didn't you notice this sooner if there were one or even multiple unauthorised transactions under your account when you clearly weren't using it?
* Or that you did notice it, why didn't you change your password immediately? Why didn't you report this immediately as soon as you noticed something wasn't right when you started seeing emails notifying you about actions that you didn't do?
* If the email was a dummy account that you barely ever use, do you suppose that's Riot's problem? The point of tying an account to an email is just so that if there's something wrong, you'd realise very quickly.
* Do you also suppose having a password so weak it can be easily brute-forced is Riot's problem? I mean I used a password consisted of 4 lower case letters and 4 numbers, which is pretty damn weak, for 4-5 years without even once getting hacked (I changed it to a much securer one some time ago), so how weak was your password?
* Also, who the hell puts RP into someone else's account anyway? Who does that? Especially when they're also scripting?
* You also said that "i have emails people putting riot points from other countires onto my account". How do you know it was from another country from your email? Because I don't believe RP purchase receipts show which country the transaction was made from, as it only shows the date and payment method/instrument?
* Were you really hacked?

EDIT: I suppose since the a Rioter has updated that OP seems to have really hacked, and unbanned the account. I guess I'll drop my case. Though personally, I am rather iffy about the legitimacy of OP's claims, but I digress.
In this case, yea I believe he was hacked. All your points regarding account security and the responsibility of the player are spot on, though.
